title: Personal Website Development
motivation: To showcase my learning journey, skills, projects, and ideas in cybersecurity and web development.
details: A self-built personal portfolio website developed from scratch using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Reflects my skills, projects, and continuous learning in both cybersecurity and web development.

title: Cat Photo App
motivation: To learn the foundational structure of web pages using HTML.
details: Built a simple cat photo application using common HTML tags to add images, text, and buttons, gaining hands-on experience with webpage structure.

title: Cafe Menu Page
motivation: To understand how CSS styles HTML elements and enhances webpage design.
details: Designed a cafe menu webpage using CSS for styling text, colors, and layout, practicing core CSS concepts for real-world UI presentation.

title: Colored Markers Display
motivation: To explore color usage in web design and improve visual appeal through CSS.
details: Created a visually engaging marker set using various CSS color properties and color-pairing techniques.

title: User Registration Form
motivation: To practice using HTML forms for gathering user input with proper validation and structure.
details: Built a full registration form using HTML input fields with validations and applied new CSS styling tools to enhance layout and accessibility.

title: User Survey Form
motivation: To apply HTML and CSS knowledge in building a survey form.
details: Developed a user-friendly survey form for collecting feedback and data, implementing input validation and responsive layout techniques.

title: Rothko-Style Painting
motivation: To understand the CSS Box Model by visually constructing box-based art.
details: Used CSS box model principles to design abstract Rothko-style rectangular paintings, practicing spacing, padding, borders, and layout behaviors.

title: Responsive Photo Gallery
motivation: To learn how to use CSS Flexbox for building responsive and dynamic layouts.
details: Created a responsive photo gallery using CSS Flexbox to adapt the layout to different screen sizes, practicing modern layout techniques for flexible design.

title: Nutrition Label Page
motivation: To learn how typography affects readability and visual structure in web design.
details: Built a nutrition label webpage using CSS typography techniques. Practiced adjusting text styling, spacing, line height, and positioning for clarity and accessibility.

title: Accessible Quiz Page
motivation: To ensure web content is usable by everyone, including people with disabilities.
details: Created a quiz webpage while applying accessibility best practices. Implemented keyboard navigation, ARIA attributes, and inclusive design strategies to enhance usability.

title: Tribute Page
motivation: Part of the final projects to earn the Responsive Web Design Certification on freeCodeCamp.
details: Built a tribute page. This project demonstrated proficiency in structuring content with HTML and styling it with CSS. The focus was on accessibility and delivering meaningful information.

title: Balance Sheet
motivation: To explore the power of CSS pseudo selectors and how they can enhance interactivity and styling in web design.
details: Built a financial balance sheet layout using CSS pseudo selectors. Learned to target and style specific HTML elements based on user interactions like hover states and other triggers. This project emphasized improving UX through dynamic styling techniques.

title: Cat Painting
motivation: To understand and apply intermediate CSS concepts like positioning, layering, and transformations in web layouts.
details: Created a stylized cat painting using intermediate CSS techniques. Focused on absolute positioning to control layout structure, z-index for element stacking, and transform for precise visual adjustments. This helped solidify my understanding of CSS layout behavior.

title: Piano Page
motivation: To learn how to make webpages adapt gracefully to different screen sizes using responsive design techniques.
details: Built a piano webpage applying responsive web design principles. This included working with CSS media queries and pseudo selectors to ensure the piano looks and functions well on various devices and screen sizes.

title: Technical Documentation Page
motivation: To practice structuring and styling technical content on the web.
details: Created a multi-section technical documentation page that presents reference material in a clean and accessible layout. Used HTML to organize content and CSS to style it with responsive design principles.

title: City Skyline
motivation: To explore how CSS variables can simplify and enhance styling consistency across a web page.
details: Built a stylized city skyline using reusable CSS variables for colors and sizing. Learned how to define, apply, and manage custom properties in CSS, improving the scalability and maintainability of web design.

title: Magazine Page
motivation: To master control over webpage layout using CSS Grid for responsive and organized design.
details: Created a magazine article layout utilizing CSS Grid to control rows and columns effectively. Gained practical experience with grid areas, row and column sizing, and responsive design principles.
